channel.title: Minor Server Help Required
channel.description:
[s]ZOMG :eek: :eek: srvr st0ff not wrking[/s]
Recently I've been working on making a new server. I've seen some tutorials and they often do not go in depth enough. I have some questions I would ask answered,
1. How do I portfoward? I know it's the step that allows people to connect to the computer, but I don't know how to do it.
2. How do I get a base and be able to edit it? I have WinRar and I'm able to extract, but what do I do after I extract it.
javac: File not found: *-java Usage: javac <options> <source files>
Then I get more errors, if I need to post them just say it.
Also I've already set the Environmental Variables:
CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
That's my classpath ^^^
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin;
This is my path ^^^
I haven't done anything about portfowarding. All I know is that you have to type some IP into the URL bar.
Also regarding two, it won't help much unless I get a decent base... Can someone post a link to theirs or someone else's. It would be helpful.
I apologize if I missed anything. If I continue error's then I will continue posting.
Even if you only answered one question, I will still appreciate it.
Thank you for taking time out of your day to read my post.

item.title: Minor Server Help Required
item.dc:creator: @keyhan3 keyhan3
item.description:
@keyhan3 wrote:

ZOMG :eek: :eek: srvr st0ff not wrking

Recently I’ve been working on making a new server. I’ve seen some tutorials and they often do not go in depth enough. I have some questions I would ask answered,

  1. How do I portfoward? I know it’s the step that allows people to connect to the computer, but I don’t know how to do it.

  2. How do I get a base and be able to edit it? I have WinRar and I’m able to extract, but what do I do after I extract it.

javac: File not found: *-java
Usage: javac

Then I get more errors, if I need to post them just say it.

Also I’ve already set the Environmental Variables:

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

That’s my classpath ^^^

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin;

This is my path ^^^

I haven’t done anything about portfowarding. All I know is that you have to type some IP into the URL bar.

Also regarding two, it won’t help much unless I get a decent base… Can someone post a link to theirs or someone else’s. It would be helpful.

I apologize if I missed anything. If I continue error’s then I will continue posting.

Even if you only answered one question, I will still appreciate it.

Thank you for taking time out of your day to read my post.
